intro: Spilorchis, commonly known as the false flax or common spilorchis, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and Africa. These plants typically have slender, erect stems and are often found in grassy or disturbed areas. The leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while the flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Spilorchis species are generally herbaceous and can be annual or perennial depending on the species.
